alert.note: Alert for City of Chesapeake; City of Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 6:31PM EDT until July 09 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The East Central City of Chesapeake in southeastern Virginia... The Central City of Virginia Beach in southeastern Virginia... * Until 845 PM EDT. * At 631 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1.5 to 2.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Virginia Beach, Chesapeake, Princess Anne, Macons Corner, Oceana NAS, Oceana, Pungo, Dam Neck, London Bridge, Sigma, Rudee Heights, Princess Anne Plaza, Sandbridge Beach and North Virginia Beach. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1.5-2.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: City of Chesapeake; City of Virginia Beach
